scene.dir: Ellen in Anny's arm. Her hair is fluttering in the wind. Ellen stretching her hands towards the sea, as if trying to defend herself.

annot.title: I must go home. He is coming.

scene.loc: In the foreground the crosses. In the back sandbank and cliffs.
scene.dir: In the distance people, hurrying to rescue the ship- wrecked.
The sand bank . The ship crashes into it . . . turns over on its side.

annot.loc: the sailing boat is moving past. Weimar

scene.dir: Knock alone. He drags up a chair . . . to the window. He climbs up on it.
Knock pulls himself up by the bars, trying to look out. The wind, blowing in, makes his hair stand on end uncannily.

scene.loc: The stranded ship Dead and forsaken. a rope is dangling from the deck. It is swaying in the wind.
An endless number of rats climbing down the swaying rope.
scene.dir: The hatch. It opens slowly.
NOSFERATU climbs out.
He carries the last coffin.
Remains standing. Motionless.
The image of death. Then he approaches slowly.

annot.loc: 2)Ship's hatch with a piece of deck.
annot.dir: Trick: 1) Canvas glides away from hatch. 2) Hatch lid is lifted. 3) Rats are rushing on deck.
4) Nosferatu coffin in arms climbs out.

scene.loc: Town center. Trees, shaken by storm.
scene.dir: A carriage races up, stops abruptly.
Hutter jumps from the carriage.
An axle is broken.
The coachman seems at a loss.
Hutter cannot wait. He leaves the carriage and runs of f.

scene.loc: Archway with a view of the harbor:

scene.dir: Ellen and Anny. Ellen suddenly breaks away. Overjoyed as if she had a happy vision she throws her arms up and shouts:

annot.title: I must go to him. He is coming!!

scene.dir: She moves off and vanishes.
Anny wrings her hands in despair.
A white figure comes out of the house. It is Ellen. She is running through the park.
Nosferatu striding
Hutter, running along the street.
Knock, moving away from the window wall
The madman is listening for outside noises, as if he had received a signal from the other world . . . triumphantly . . . he whispers to himself:

annot.title: The master is near . . .the master is near . . .!

scene.dir: Suddenly, he listens attentively. He creeps over to the door. There he waits expectantly . . . The door opens. The attendant appears. He looks around the room. Not noticing that Knock is behind him. Knock creeps carefully behind his back. Suddenly frightened, the attendant turns around. Knock makes for his throat like a vampire. The attendant falls over. The madman is at his throat for a moment only, then he lets go and sneaks out.
Hutter comes running up. He looks up: no light. He is just about to enter when - somebody is calling. He turns around Ellen!!!!! They fall into each other's arms.
Nosferatu, cof˚n under his arm, is standing in the middle of the square. Looking around to orientate himself. Then he strides on.
A lamp is shining. Hutter and Ellen. They are sitting on the chaise lounge. The happiness of being reunited was too much. Overpowered by emotion, he sinks down on her arm.
Nosferatu, staring up
Hutter and Ellen, on the chaise lounge. He sits up, looking deep into her eyes.
scene.title: Thank God . . . you are well . . .now everything has come all right.
scene.dir: She does not understand him. But the joy of being to- gether again is stronger than anything else. And the room is bright.

scene.loc: Street in front of Hutter's House
scene.dir: There is nobody about. But in the middle of the street stands NOSFERATU, hidden by the night, carrying the cof fin. Slowly, he turns his head and looks over to Hutter's house.
[There is a friendly light in the window]
The deserted house Empty! Carrying the coffin - Nosferatu appears in picture.
NOSFERATU. Once more he turns his head. He looks over to the other side. The deserted house is over there. He makes for that now, walking slow. Then he goes into the house.
The captain, collapsed in death, is tied to the helm. In the foreground, some men, Harding among them, are climbing up on deck. They are aghast at the terrible sight.

The dead captain. Tied to the helm in discharge of his duty! One hand is still on the helm. The other, holding a crucifix, clutches his chest in mortal agony. His head sunk back, face distorted. There are two red marks on his neck . . .
Harding. He cannot comprehend the horror . . .

scene.loc: Sandbank harbor The stranded ship is in sight.
scene.dir: In the blowing wind nocturnal figures . . .townspeople
Down the tilted hulk a man is climbing along a rope.
By the light of a torch! the captain of the harbor with a number of old people . . . Looking like fishermen. The climber approaches and reports.
scene.title: Everything has been examined . . No living soul on board. The captain receives the report . . . jots down some notes.

scene.dir: Some men are lifting up the dead captain, and carrying off the corpse.
Harding alone . . . he finds a book next to a masthead that is affixed to the helm. In the light of a dim lantern he reads:
scene.cam: Close-up: A page of the book
scene.p: Varna - July 12 Crew - apart from myself the captain - one helmsman mate and five sailors. Departing - for the Dardanelles.
scene.dir: Harding shakes his head. He is puzzled.
Harding emerges from the cabin with the book in his hand.

scene.loc: Port Authority building A large hall. On the walls a number of figure heads Models of ships are suspended from the ceiling.
scene.dir: The dead captain [is carried] in lying in state.
Dr. Sievers is examining him. He notices the marks on his neck. Dr. Sievers turns to Harding.
He, too, cannot make sense of this case. Nevertheless he talks incessantly. Harding comes closer shows him the log-book. Both of them are reading:

A page: Second day: July 13 A sailor has fallen ill with a fever. Course: SSW. Direction of wind: Third day: July 14 Mate is talking strangely. He says there is an unknown passenger below deck. Course SE. Direction of wind NE. Volume of wind 3.6.
Sievers and Harding are looking at each other. Sievers' white beard is trembling. They continue reading. Tenth day: July 22 Rats in the ship's hold. Danger of plague.
Harding has been reading this aloud. Now Sievers understands at last. He points to the book with his finger. Danger of plague! That's what it is. Dan- ger of plague, he calls out.
scene.title: Danger of plague! Go home! Shut all your windows and doors! Deeply frightened, the bystanders move away. The women put the ends of their head-scarves into their mouths. Panic- stricken .the crowd leaves the room.

scene.loc: A deserted square: Nobody is about. Except in the center of the square, the town-drummer with his large drum.
scene.dir: The drummer. He beats a mighty roll.
The hatch opens and a woman's head appears: totally emaciated, sunken cheeks, long dishevelled hair. The disease has gripped her too. On her neck the ominous little marks.
The drummer has produced a piece of paper and reads it aloud:
scene.p: magistrate of this town prohibits any movement of plague-suspects into hospitals to prevent the plague from spreading through the streets.
scene.dir: The drummer has finished reading and goes off.
A man emerges from a front door. He shuts the door behind him. Quickly and with circumspection he chalks a white cross on the door. Then goes on.
The man knocks hard on the door. From a window above a head looks out. There are still people living here. The man moves on.
scene.loc: The first house in the side-street.
scene.dir: A coffin is being carried out. Men carrying it have white bandages over their mouths. The man comes along and dr aws a cross on this house, too. Then he walks on, following his horrible business.

scene.loc: shaded candle on table near armchair .
scene.dir: Book-cover Inscription (Vampire) See Chapter 1 of book.
Ellen by the window, the book on her knees continues reading, overcoming her aversion.
Chapter II appears.
Ellen is pondering on what she has read.
Hutter comes into the picture, with agitation almost hostility he grabs the book.
Ellen, standing now, looks straight into his eyes, turns and points over to the deserted house.
scene.annot: Compare the following black dress and shawl
scene.dir: Ellen by the window. Hutter approaches from the door
Suddenly, she grabs his arm, stares out of the window pointing out, she shouts: There!!!
Her body is tensed up like a bow trembling with excitement.

scene.loc: The deserted house Seen through Ellen's window frame.
scene.cam: Almost at once dissolve to window.
scene.loc: A window, divided into four rectangular panes. Light from behind.
scene.dir: Stuck to the window, almost completely covering it, something looking like a black fourlegged spider. It takes a moment before one can make out Nos- feratu's fingers which are clawing the window frame. In the center of the body, grinning lasciviously, the waxen face with ratlike teeth.
Ellen holds frantically on to Hutter's hand [shaken] breathing heavily She bends her head back. towards him saying.
scene.title: This is how I see it- every evening. . .!!!
scene.dir: She bends her head back. She knows all she has to know. And there is peace in the knowledge.
Hutter has not come to that yet. He finds her calm- ness disturbing. He follows the retreating figure with his eyes.
Ellen is swaying.
Hutter, despairingly, presses his fist against his face.
The lamp-lighter comes down the darkening street and lights up the street-lamps. The he walks on.
Anny crouching on a chaise lounge.
Bent over her Harding who is holding her hands and trying to calm down the struggling woman who is shaking fitfully.
She collapses with exhaustion. Then pulls himself together and decides:
scene.title: I will run over quickly . . . I shall get Sievers. And he is gone.
scene.dir: Anny, having almost fainted with fear, comes to again. She opens her eyes. She lifts her head. No- body around?? Is she all alone?? Isn't there some- thing moving about in the corner? Something fluttering at the window?
The window, covered by the curtain. Behind it the shadow of a giant bat. It grows and grows. Soon it isn't a bat any long- er. A vampire! NOSTERATU?!
Anny's body hits the wall. She jumps up and pulls the bell. Then half crazed with fear, she runs into the background.
Servants running to and fro in the direc- tion of the bedroom.
The bell is ringing.
A servant asleep doesn't hear, turns over in his sleep
Anny pressed close to the wall.
Servants are rushing in.
There! She shouts pointing to the window.
Like a flock of chicken the women are huddling together.

Anny rushes over to them, but they are already so gripped by fear that they imagine her fingers, which they are trying to push back, to be the vampire's claws. Shrieking, they run off in all directions. The door is slammed shut. Anny beats against the door. She is waiting for the horror, but she doesn't want to see it, much rather die first. She grabs a table cloth and covers her head and neck. Then she collapses.
Ellen by the window . . .looking out. She stands motionless. Paralysed by misery she witnesses the daily scene of wretchedness.

scene.loc: Street in front of Hutter's's house
scene.dir: Ascending. In the distance, a strange procession is wandering across the street. One coffin after another carried by survivors. Past Hutter's house, towards the procession, a man is dragging himself along, tired to death. She supports himself by a stick. He catches sight of the distant procession and lifts up his hands to heaven in misery.
with window -frame Ellen
Ellen, on the point of fainting, turns away from the window She cannot bear the sight of this wretchedness any longer. She sinks into a chair, resting her head in her hands.
The book, open. She has been reading it for days
scene.cam: Close up: A page of the book:
scene.p: ONLY IF A CHASTE WOMAN CAN FEARLESSLY MAKE HIM MISS THE FIRST CROWING OF THE COCK WILL HE DISINTEGRATE IN THE LIGHT OF DAWN
scene.dir: Ellen lifts up her head, staring into space like a visionary. She knows. She shuts her eyes.

Harding - haggard - a broken man, comes out. He closes the door and supports himself against the door-post. His hand reaches up, paints a black cross on the door . . .and falls down. His hollow eyes refrain from looking at his work . . . again . . . they cannot bear to see the symbol. He moves forward with a glazed look in his eyes.

scene.loc: In front of deserted house Street
scene.dir: A group of emaciated men with a fanatical look about them are standing around. An unkept-looking woman is haranguing them. They are raising their fists.
scene.title: He has been seen! He ran out of the house! He strangled the attendant!

scene.dir: Two ancient women are sitting by the well. Death has no terrors for them. Since every new day is a present to them.
The are whispering to each other; their heads are trembling.
scene.title: In the deserted house. . . that's where it is hiding. He strangled him. The vampire.
scene.dir: Further back agitated people are running across the square, shouting excitedly to one another. The two woman turn around gesturing ˚ercely. The clench their bony fists threateningly. Harding can be seen behind the well. He has heard everything.
He utters a bitter and mocking laugh.
Harding walks on.
Crossing. Crowd gathering from all sides, then moving in one direction.
A street-corner with a man who points at something above. People rush up to him; they all turn to face the same way, look up, make threatening gestures Somebody throws stones.
A figure is crouching on a roof-top
It is Knock. He is looking down with a sneer on his face and pokes out his tongue A stone whizzes part him. He suddenly gets up and clambers off.

Ellen in an old armchair, busy embroidering a cushion in the cross-stitch manner of the 1840s An inscription reading: I LOVE YOU She puts down her work, resting her head. Tired, she falls to day-dreaming. Then she lights a lamp.
Ellen takes up her work again, determined to finish it.
The street is empty.
Knock jumps down a wall and runs off. In the distance some men appear, chasing him. They catch sight of him and rush af ter him.

scene.cam: Shot against a wide expanse of sky.
scene.dir: In the distance running figures, no more then silhouettes (Turn slowly) Knock in front. His pursuers following a long way behind.

scene.loc: Fields. Evening mists. Cornfields waving in the wind.
scene.dir: Suddenly, right in front between the ears of corn head. Dishevelled hair. Then a bony back The heads turn around slowly. It is Knock.

scene.time: The landscape has grown dim in the evening light.
scene.dir: The men chasing Knock are approaching. They stop. They seem to have lost the tr ail. Suddenly, one of them sees something. He opens his eyes wide, shouting: there!!! They all look one way. They dash off in that direction.

In the distance one can still the back and dis- hevelled head. Is it Knock? He seems not to hear or see his pursuers. The men are coming near, rushing towards him across the field. They lift their sticks and fists.
scene.loc: A scare-crow. A black coat is dangling on a stick. Bits of straw and tattered rags.
scene.dir: The men fall on it in the disappointment. Suddenly they stop. There! What can that be !!!
A hundred feet away a head has appeared. Then the f igure of a man. It is moving away quickly. The chase starts up again.

scene.title: Night
scene.dir: Medium Nosferatu at the window.
Ellen wakes up. She sits up in bed, listening as if she had heard somebody calling her. She gets up, walking as if pulled by invisible threads.
She goes over to the window. In the fore- ground Hutter asleep in an armchair, look- ing worn out.
Ellen is clinging to the window. She sees.
Nosferatu at the window. He raises his arms slowly.

Ellen is about to collapse by the window. Shaking with fear she struggles violently with herself. The last battle. Twice her hands comes up to open the window and drops down again weakly; then, with sudden determination, she pulls herself up dead straight and deliberately throws the window wide open.
Nosferatu moves away from the window, turns around and disappears.
Ellen trembling with fear and apprehension
Suddenly the gates swing open:
Nosferatu appears
Ellen is covering her face with her hands, seized with mortal fear.
scene.cam: Long shot; window moves out of picture
scene.dir: Ellen at window. She wants to call for help. She staggers forward. She stops in front of Hutter. One last moment of indecision. Then she wakes him up. Hutter jumps to his feet. He catches the trembling figure in his arms. and carries her over to the sofa. She begs him, hands raised as if in prayer:
She entreats him to go. Hutter takes her hands, she quickly kisses his head, Then he rushes out.

scene.loc: In front of Hutter's House. A path bordered by flowers.
scene.dir: Hutter rushes out.
scene.cost: Trousers, pleated shirt, collar without tie. No hat no waist coat.

scene.dir: Ellen is still looking in the direction she saw Hutter leave, then she gets up and walks toward the window.
Nosferatu is walking forward and moves out of the picture.
The house looks more deserted than ever!
Nobody is about.
Nosferatu is approaching. He comes to a halt. (He is preparing to jump, looks up) He enters the house.

Ellen turns around suddenly. She is shaking with fear, anticipating the horror about to happen. And it is coming - - slowly, tensed like a predatory animal. She recoils, moves backwards step by step, and step by step it follows her Heart! - Hand

scene.loc: In addition to the already familiar fish tanks there is a large telescope by a window. A profusion of antiquated scientific gadgets, globes etc. A lamp is burning.
scene.dir: Bulwer asleep in dressing-gown and night-cap in the armchair. Cages with birds and all kinds of animals. Hutter rushes in. He wakes Bulwer, begs him to come with him. Bulwer starts to get dressed.

scene.loc: A municipal building on the period (town hall)
scene.dir: A large crowd is gathering in front of the town hall. Knock has been captured. More people keep pouring in from all sides.

scene.loc: An office room inside the town hall
scene.dir: Sievers rushes in excitedly from the adjoining room accompanied by a man who has brought him the news. From the other side Knock is being brought in. The lunatic is trembling with fear. exit
Ellen in bed, the strangler is at her throat, his fingers clawing her arms. Her eyes, widened in mortal fear, have a glazed look. Then she seems to have heard something.
A cock jumps on to a still-life farm implements. He flaps his wings, puffs up his throat and her- alds the morning.
Knock Inside the town hall Knock at the window, held by two men. Trying to ward them off, he shouts anxiously:
scene.title: The master . . . the master . . .!

scene.dir: Nosferatu raises his head. He looks drunk with pleasure. Ellen eyes are full of terrible fear. She must not allow Nosferatu just to go. She pulls her arms around him: he cannot resist and bends his head over her again.

scene.loc: The sun is rising over the small town.

scene.dir: Ellen's last moment of apprehension.
scene.loc: There, isn't that a flicker of sunlight on the wall over her bed?
scene.dir: Here eyes light up hopefully and remain fixed on this first sign of the new day. She stretches out her hand for it. And look: it is moving downwards.
Then shoulders of Hutter and Bulwer appear. They are hurrying on and turning into a side street.

scene.loc: The bed is bathed in sunlight.
scene.dir: Ellen's eyes are full of anticipation

. Has she sacrificed herself in vain? Suddenly the horrible figure jerks himself up. He looks about in amazement. He clutches his heart. The bestial tenseness of his bearing relaxes. For a moment he stands, legs apart, as if trying to regain his balance. He clutches his heart again and falls on his knees, his face turned to the sun, distorted by pain.
Knock, in a straitjacket, alone in the sunlight which is falling through a barred window. He is mumbling disconnected words:
scene.title: The master . . .the master . . . is dead.
scene.dir: His head sinks on to his chest.

Nosferatu on his knees, supporting himself with one hand on the ground. He raises the other in the direction of the sun to shield himself from the light that brings him death. But he cannot hold out against the sun. His fingers, his hand, his arm are dissolving in the light. The sun seems about to strike his heart. Now his body is dis- integrating in the light. Ellen throws up her hands triumphantly calling:
scene.title: Hutter!

scene.cam: Shot looking out from the doorway into the distance.
scene.dir: Bulwer and Hutter are running, not just walking into the house.
Ellen in bed.
In anticipation, her hand reaches out for Hutter. Hutter comes rushing in, falls on his knees by the bed. He t akes hold of her hand.
Her hand grasps his, the it lets go weakly and drops away. Ellen's head falls over - - - - Bulwer is standing at the window, hands behind his back looking out.
